name: SonarQubePrepare
author: sonarsource
releaseNotes: * __Support non MSBuild projects:__ This task can be used to configure analysis also for non MSBuild projects.

inputs.name: SonarQube
inputs.label: SonarQube Server Endpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the SonarQube server endpoint for your project. To create one, click the Manage link and create a new SonarQube Server Endpoint, enter your server url and token.

inputs.name: scannerMode
inputs.label: Choose the way to run the analysis
inputs.helpMarkDown:
####dotnet
* Put this task before your build task
* Add the 'Run Code Analysis' task after the MSBuild/VSTest tasks
####Maven/Gradle
* Put this task before the Maven/Gradle task
* Tick the 'Run SonarQube Analysis' checkbox in the Maven/Gradle task configuration.
####Others
For other cases you can use the standalone scanner (sonar-scanner) and set all configuration with this task, and then add the 'Run Code Analysis' task

inputs.name: dotnetScannerVersion
inputs.label: .NET Scanner Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the version of the .NET Scanner to use. Versions can be located [here](https://github.com/SonarSource/sonar-scanner-msbuild/tags).

inputs.name: cliScannerVersion
inputs.label: Scanner CLI Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the version of the CLI scanner to use. Versions can be located [here](https://github.com/SonarSource/sonar-scanner-cli/tags).

options.file: Store configuration with my source code (sonar-project.properties)

inputs.name: cliProjectKey
inputs.label: Project Key
inputs.helpMarkDown: The SonarQube project unique key, i.e. `sonar.projectKey`

inputs.name: projectKey
inputs.label: Project Key
inputs.helpMarkDown: The SonarQube project unique key, i.e. `sonar.projectKey`

inputs.name: cliSources
inputs.label: Sources directory root
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the root directory containing source files. This value is set to the `sonar.sources` SonarQube property

inputs.name: extraProperties
inputs.label: Additional Properties
inputs.defaultValue:
# Additional properties that will be passed to the scanner, 
# Put one key=value per line, example:
# sonar.exclusions=**/*.bin
inputs.helpMarkDown: [Additional properties](https://docs.sonarsource.com/sonarqube/latest/analyzing-source-code/analysis-parameters/) to be passed to the scanner. Specify each key=value pair on a new line.
